Name: Port Moresby
Description: Port Moresby (Tok Pisin: Pot Mosbi) is the capital of Papua New Guinea.

Name: Alotau
Description: Alotau is a city in Milne Bay province in Papua New Guinea.

Name: Goroka
Description: Goroka is a city in the Eastern Highlands of Papua New Guinea (PNG). Famous for the yearly Goroka Show, it is also one of the closest major towns to Mt. Wilhelm, the highest summit in the country.

Name: Lae
Description: Lae is a city in the Huon Gulf region of Papua New Guinea.

Name: Madang (town)
Description: Madang is a town in Madang Province on the north coast of Papua New Guinea. In 2005 it had a population of almost 30,000. The town is said to be one of the prettiest towns in the South Pacific.  It is a pleasant and laid back town and likely the best place to begin your PNG visit.  PMVs can get you to the highlands on a spectacular bit of highway and ferries can get you to Wewak.

Name: Mount Hagen
Description: Mt. Hagen is a city in the Western Highlands province of Papua New Guinea.

Name: Rabaul
Description: Rabaul is the former provincial capital of East New Britain in Papua New Guinea.  It was evacuated and nearly destroyed in 1994 when the nearby volcano Tavurvur erupted. As a tourist destination, Rabaul is popular for scuba diving and for snorkelling sites and also offers a spectacular harbour. Because of its war-time history it attracts many Japanese visitors. This article covers Rabaul and the neighboring town of Kokopo, to which the authorities moved the provincial capital after the eruption.

Name: Vanimo
Description: Vanimo is the capital of West Sepik, or Sandaun, province in the Sepik region of Papua New Guinea. You can travel overland to or from the neighbouring Indonesian province of Papua via Vanimo.

Name: Wewak
Description: Wewak is the capital of the East Sepik province in the Sepik region of Papua New Guinea.

Name: Kokoda Track
Description: The Kokoda Track is in Papua New Guinea.

Name: Louisiade Archipelago
Description:
Louisiade Archipelago is in Milne Bay in Papua New Guinea. It is
a beautiful, peaceful area in the south eastern tip of Papua New Guinea and is renowned for its beautiful coral reefs, a diver's paradise. Apart from passing yachties it receives very few tourists.

Name: Trobriand Islands
Description: The Trobriand Islands (also known as the Kiriwina Islands) are a group of raised coral atolls in the north of Milne Bay Province in Papua New Guinea.

Name: Tufi
Description: Tufi is a small town on the northeast coast of Papua New Guinea (PNG) in the area known as the Fjordland of PNG, The area has spectacular scenery and is also famous for its production of tapa, a decorated cloth produced from the bark of the paper mulberry tree, which is also found in Tonga, Samoa and Fiji. In the Second World War it provided a temporary base for US PT Boats in the battle against the Japanese. Two boats sunk in March 1943 now provide a popular dive site.
